attr.name: zmailDomainStatus
attr.desc:
domain status. enum values are akin to those of zmailAccountStatus but the status affects all accounts on the domain. See table below for how zmailDomainStatus affects account status.
active - see zmailAccountStatus maintenance - see zmailAccountStatus locked - see zmailAccountStatus closed - see zmailAccountStatus suspended - maintenance + no creating/deleting/modifying accounts/DLs under the domain. shutdown - suspended + cannot modify domain attrs + cannot delete the domain Indicating server is doing major and lengthy maintenance work on the domain, e.g. renaming the domain and moving LDAP entries. Modification and deletion of the domain can only be done internally by the server when it is safe to release the domain, they cannot be done in admin console or zmprov.
How zmailDomainStatus affects account behavior : ------------------------------------- zmailDomainStatus account behavior ------------------------------------- active zmailAccountStatus locked zmailAccountStatus if it is maintenance or pending or closed, else locked maintenance zmailAccountStatus if it is pending or closed, else maintenance suspended zmailAccountStatus if it is pending or closed, else maintenance shutdown zmailAccountStatus if it is pending or closed, else maintenance closed closed

attr.name: zmailReverseProxyIPLoginLimit
attr.desc: Sets the upper limit on logins from a remote IP via POP or IMAP to this proxy server after which login is rejected with an appropriate protocol specific bye response. This counter is cumulative for all users that appear to the proxy to be logging in from the same IP address. If multiple users appear to the proxy to be logging in from the same IP address (usual with NATing), then each of the different users login will contribute to increasing the hit counter for that IP address, and when the counter eventually exceeds the limit, then the connections from that IP address will be throttled. Therefore, all users from the same IP will contribute to (and be affected by) this counter. Logins using all protocols (POP3/POP3S/IMAP/IMAPS) will affect this counter (the counter is aggregate for all protocols, *not* separate). If this value is set to 0, then no limiting will take place for any IP.

attr.name: zmailReverseProxyIPLoginLimitTime
attr.desc: Sets the time-to-live for the hit counter for IP based login throttling. If time is set to 3600 and limit is set to 1000, then it means that NGINX should not allow more than 1000 users to log in via the proxy from the same IP, within the time interval of an hour. The semantics for such a configuration would then be: allow maximum 1000 users per hour from any given IP address.

attr.name: zmailReverseProxyUserLoginLimit
attr.desc: Limit how many times a user can login via the proxy. Setting limit to 100 and time to 3600 means: allow maximum 100 logins per hour for any user. As with the ip counterparts, the user hit counter and timeout are cumulative for all protocols. Also, for a given users login, both counters are checked in succession, with the IP counter being checked first. A login may be rejected (throttled) because the IP is over-usage, or because the login name itself is over-usage. A value of 0 indicates that no throttling will take place for any user.

attr.name: zmailReverseProxyUserLoginLimitTime
attr.desc: Sets the time-to-live for the hit counter for per user login throttling.

In our web app, AJAX and standard html client, we have support for adding the HTTP client IP address as X-Originating-IP in an outbound message. We also use the HTTP client IP address in our logging.
In the case of standard client making connections to the SOAP layer, the JSP layer tells the SOAP layer in a http header what the remote HTTP client address is. In the case where nginx or some other proxy layer is fronting our webapps, the proxy tells the SOAP/JSP layers in a http header what the real HTTP client s address is.

attr.name: zmailMailSSLClientCertPrincipalMap
attr.desc:
Map from a certificate field to a Zmail account key that can uniquely identify a Zmail account for client certificate authentication. Value is a comma-separated list of mapping rules, each mapping maps a certificate field to a Zmail account key. Each is attempted in sequence until a unique account can be resolved.
e.g. a value can be: SUBJECTALTNAME_OTHERNAME_UPN=zmailForeignPrincipal,(uid=%{SUBJECT_CN})
value: comma-separated mapping-rule
mapping-rule: {cert-field-to-zmail-key-map} | {LDAP-filter}
cert-field-to-zmail-key-map: {certificate-field}={Zmail-account-key}
certificate-field: SUBJECT_{an RDN attr, e.g. CN}: a RND in DN of Subject SUBJECT_DN: entire DN of Subject SUBJECTALTNAME_OTHERNAME_UPN: UPN(aka Principal Name) in otherName in subjectAltName extension SUBJECTALTNAME_RFC822NAME: rfc822Name in subjectAltName extension
Zmail-account-key: name: primary name or any of the aliases of an account zmailId: zmailId of an account zmailForeignPrincipal: zmailForeignPrincipal of an account. The matching value on the zmailForeignPrincipal must be prefixed with "cert {supported-certificate-filed}:" e.g. cert SUBJECTALTNAME_OTHERNAME_UPN:123456@mydomain
LDAP-filter: An LDAP filter template with placeholders to be substituted by certificate field values. (objectClass=zmailAccount) is internally ANDed with the supplied filter. e.g. (|(uid=%{SUBJECT_CN})(mail=%{SUBJECTALTNAME_RFC822NAME}))
Note: it is recommended not to use LDAP-filter rule, as it will trigger an LDAP search for each cert auth request. LDAP-filter is disabled by default. To enable it globally, set zmailMailSSLClientCertPrincipalMapLdapFilterEnabled on global config to TRUE. If LDAP-filter is not enabled, all client certificate authentication will fail on domains configured with LDAP-filter.

attr.name: zmailAutoProvMode
attr.desc:
Auto provision modes enabled. Multiple modes can be enabled on a domain.
EAGER: A server maintenance thread automatically polls the configured external auto provision LDAP source at a configured interval for entries due to be auto provisioned in Zmail, and then auto creates the accounts in Zmail directory.
LAZY: auto creates the Zmail account when user first login via one of the external auth mechanisms enabled for auto provisioning. Auth mechanisms enabled for auto provisioning are configured in zmailAutoProvAuthMech.
MANUAL: admin to search from the configured external auto provision LDAP source and select an entry from the search result to create the corresponding Zmail account for the external entry.
In all cases, localpart of the Zmail account is mapped from an attribute on the external entry based on zmailAutoProvAccountNameMap. The Zmail account is populated with attributes mapped from the external entry based on zmailAutoProvAttrMap.

attr.name: zmailAutoProvAuthMech
attr.desc:

attr.name: zmailAutoProvPollingInterval
attr.desc:
EAGER mode: required LAZY mode: N/A MANUAL mode: N/A

At each interval, the auto provision thread iterates through all domains in zmailAutoProvScheduledDomains and auto creates up to domain.zmailAutoProvBatchSize accounts. attr.name: zmailThrottleSafeHosts
attr.desc: Hosts to ignore during IP based throttling. Typically should list nginx hostname and any other mailbox servers which can proxy to this server

attr.name: zmailReverseProxyDnsLookupInServerEnabled
attr.desc: Control whether force the server side do the DNS lookup and send the result IP back to proxy. If set false, the raw address configured (e.g. zmailMailHost) is directly sent to proxy.

attr.name: zmailFileAndroidCrashReportingEnabled
attr.desc: whether crash reporting is enabled in the Android client

attr.name: zmailInternalSharingCrossDomainEnabled
attr.desc: whether sharing with accounts and groups of all other domains hosted on this deployment be considered internal sharing

attr.name: zmailInternalSharingDomain
attr.desc: Domains hosted on this deployment, accounts and groups of which are considered internal during sharing. Applicable when zmailInternalSharingCrossDomainEnabled is set to FALSE.

attr.name: zmailFeatureSocialcastEnabled
attr.desc: whether Socialcast integration is enabled in the web client

attr.name: zmailSocialcastURL
attr.desc: URL for Socialcast integration

attr.name: zmailFileIOSCrashReportingEnabled
attr.desc: whether crash reporting is enabled in the IOS client

attr.name: zmailZimletLoadSynchronously
attr.desc: Whether to load zimlets synchronously in the web client. If set to TRUE, users are not allowed to use the core app before zimlets are loaded. If set to FALSE, zimlets are loaded in the background and users are allowed to use the core app before all zimlets finish loading.

attr.name: zmailProduct
attr.desc: whether this instance of Zmail is running ZCS or some other derivative product

attr.name: zmailHsmMovePreviousRevisions
attr.desc: Keep only the tip revision in the main volume, and move all the old revisions to the secondary volume. For document type mail items only, works independently of zmailHsmPolicy.

attr.name: zmailPrefConvShowCalendar
attr.desc: When displaying an invite in a conversation, show the day calendar immediately.

attr.name: zmailMailSSLClientCertOCSPEnabled
attr.desc: enable OCSP support for two way authentication.

attr.name: zmailDevicePasscodeEnabled
attr.desc: Whether device is password protected in native apps

attr.name: zmailDeviceAllowedPasscodeLockoutDuration
attr.desc: allowed passcode lockout duration

attr.name: zmailDevicePasscodeLockoutDuration
attr.desc: passcode lockout duration

attr.name: zmailDeviceLockWhenInactive
attr.desc: For native apps - whether to lock device when inactive.

attr.name: zmailDeviceFileOpenWithEnabled
attr.desc: Whether OpenWith feature is enabled on devices.

attr.name: zmailUCServiceId
attr.desc: UC service zmailId

attr.name: zmailUCProvider
attr.desc: provider for the UC service

attr.name: zmailUCUserURL
attr.desc: user info service URL for the UC service

attr.name: zmailUCVoicemailURL
attr.desc: voicemail service URL for the UC service

attr.name: zmailUCCallControlURL
attr.desc: call control service URL for the UC service

attr.name: zmailUCPresenceURL
attr.desc: presence service URL for the UC service

attr.name: zmailUCPresenceSessionId
attr.desc: presence session id for Cisco presence service

attr.name: zmailUCUsername
attr.desc: username for the user's UC service

attr.name: zmailUCPassword
attr.desc: password for the user's UC service

attr.name: zmailUCProviderEnabled
attr.desc: Designated UC provider of the system

attr.name: zmailMobilePolicyApprovedApplicationList
attr.desc: This is the internal attr for "zmailMobilePolicyApprovedApplication" which can only store app hash (to keep consistent with ActiveSync specification. This attr's format is "app_name":"app_hash", and is used for showing both the app name and hash in admin console UI

attr.name: zmailDeviceOfflineCacheEnabled
attr.desc: Whether offline reading of documents on device is allowed

attr.name: zmailGalDefinitionLastModifiedTime
attr.desc: the time at which GAL definition is last modified.

attr.name: zmailVirtualAccountInitialPasswordSet
attr.desc: Whether virtual user set/changed his password after an external virtual account for him is provisioned. This attribute is applicable for accounts having zmailIsExternalVirtualAccount set to TRUE.

attr.name: zmailMessageChannelPort
attr.desc: port number on which message channel should listen

attr.name: zmailClientTypeRegex
attr.desc: Regex for identifying client types

attr.name: zmailMessageChannelEnabled
attr.desc: whether message channel service is enabled on this server

attr.name: zmailDataSourceImportOnLogin
attr.desc: whether to invoke data imports for all data sources owned by an account after successful user login from the login page

attr.name: zmailPrefFromAddressType
attr.desc: Type of the email address from header. (sendAs or sendOnBehalfOf)

attr.name: zmailLdapGalSyncDisabled
attr.desc: whether ldap based galsync disabled or not

attr.name: zmailPrefColorMessagesEnabled
attr.desc: whether or not to use tag color as the color for message items

attr.name: zmailMobileMetadataMaxSizeEnabled
attr.desc: whether or not to enable truncating on client metadata size, if enabled server will only track recent items on client device instead of all

attr.name: zmailMobileItemsToTrackPerFolderMaxSize
attr.desc: Max size of items in a folder that server tracks, categorized by collection type (Email,Calendar,Contacts,Tasks). e.g. Email:3000 makes the max size of items to track for an Email folder to be 3000. If not specify, default value is Integer.MAX_VALUE

attr.name: zmailHttpThrottleSafeIPs
attr.desc: IP addresses to ignore when applying Jetty DosFilter.

attr.name: zmailHttpConnectorMaxIdleTimeMillis
attr.desc: Maximum Idle time in milli seconds for a connection. This is applied when waiting for a new request to be received on a connection; when reading the headers and content of a request; when writing the headers and content of a response.

attr.name: zmailHttpThreadPoolMaxIdleTimeMillis
attr.desc: The maximum thread idle time in milli seconds. Threads that are idle for longer than this period may be stopped.

attr.name: zmailHttpDosFilterDelayMillis
attr.desc: Delay imposed on all requests over the rate limit, before they are considered at all. -1 = Reject request, 0 = No delay, any other value = Delay in ms

attr.name: zmailHttpDosFilterMaxRequestsPerSec
attr.desc: Maximum number of requests from a connection per second. Requests in excess of this are throttled.

attr.name: zmailPrefSpellIgnorePattern
attr.desc: Regular Expression for words to ignore during spell check.

attr.name: zmailMtaFallbackRelayHost
attr.desc: Fallback value for postconf relayhost.

attr.name: zmailForceClearCookies
attr.desc: Whether to force clear zmail auth cookies when SOAP session ends (i.e. force logout on browser tab close)

attr.name: zmailFeatureDistributionListFolderEnabled
attr.desc: Whether to display the distribution list folder in address book

attr.name: zmailMobileSyncKeyFormatConvertedFolders
attr.desc: folders whose sync key are already converted, each device has a list of folders. e.g. ApplDN6GJSQJDFHW:0,2,10 meaning device ApplDN6GJSQJDFHW's folders, inbox and calendar folder sync key format are converted, use 0 for FolderSync

attr.name: zmailReverseProxyUpstreamConnectTimeout
attr.desc: The connect timeout is the time interval after which NGINX will disconnect while establishing an upstream HTTP connection. Measured in seconds, should not be more than 75 seconds.

attr.name: zmailDataSourceActiveSyncPollingInterval
attr.desc: The time interval between automated data imports for a ActiveSync data source. If unset or 0, the data source will not be scheduled for automated polling.
